results:
Based on my search, I can provide you with information about Mark Twain digital resources, though the results don't show specific manuscripts or digital archives collaboration between the Mark Twain Museum in Hannibal and Project Gutenberg.

Here's what I found:

**Project Gutenberg Tom Sawyer Collection:**
Project Gutenberg offers "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, Complete" by Mark Twain as a free digitized ebook that has been "proofread by volunteers."(no content)The complete text was first released on July 1, 2004 as eBook #74 and was most recently updated on May 10, 2025.(no content)Project Gutenberg also has "Tom Sawyer Abroad" available "for the use of anyone anywhere in the United States and most other parts of the world at no cost" under the Project Gutenberg License.

**Mark Twain Museum in Hannibal:**
The Mark Twain Boyhood Home & Museum offers tours of "historic museum properties located in the heart of Hannibal, MO."(no content)The museum features live performances about "The Inspiration for Tom Sawyer" by professional Mark Twain performer Jim Waddell.

**Connection to Hannibal:**
The novel is "set in the 1830s-1840s in the town of St. Petersburg, which is based on Hannibal, Missouri, where Twain lived as a boy" and "many of the places in it are real and today support a tourist industry."

**Internet Archive Resources:**
The Internet Archive also provides free access to various editions of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer," including versions with original illustrations.

The search didn't reveal specific information about manuscript digitization projects or formal partnerships between the Mark Twain Museum in Hannibal and Project Gutenberg for digitizing original Tom Sawyer manuscripts. The available digital texts appear to be based on published editions rather than original manuscripts.
